contentrichtext.text: '''Quintus Caecilius Metellus Balearicus''' (b. c. 170 BC) was a son of [[Quintus Caecilius Metellus Macedonicus]]. He was a [[Roman consul|Consul]] in 123 BC and a [[Roman censor|Censor]] in 120 BC, dominated [[Corsica et Sardinia|Sardinia]] and conquered the [[Balearic Islands#Ancient history|Balearic Islands]] - for which he earned his [[cognomen]] and the honours of [[Roman Triumph|Triumph]] - establishing at [[Palma, Majorca|Palma]] and Pollentia two [[Colonia (Roman)|colonies]] of 3,000 [[Ancient Rome|Romans]] and [[Iberians]]. He was the father of: * [[Quintus Caecilius Metellus Nepos]] * [[Caecilia Metella (priestess)|Caecilia Metella]], [[Vestal Virgin]] and a [[Priest]]ess of the [[Goddess]] [[Juno Sospita]]. * [[Caecilia Metella Balearica|Caecilia Metella]], wife of [[Appius Claudius Pulcher (praetor 88 BC)|Appius Claudius Pulcher]] (Caecilia Metella was the name of many, if not all, women in the [[Caecilius Metellus]] family) ==See also== * [[Caecilia (gens)]] * [[Caecilius Metellus]] ==Further reading== * Manuel Dejante Pinto de Magalhães Arnao Metello and João Carlos Metello de Nápoles, "Metellos de Portugal, Brasil e Roma", Torres Novas, 1998 {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=[[List of Roman Republican consuls|Consul]] of the [[Roman Republic]]|before=[[Gaius Cassius Longinus (consul 124 BC)|Gaius Cassius Longinus]] and [[Gaius Sextius Calvinus (consul 124 BC)|Gaius Sextius Calvinus]]||after=[[Gnaeus Domitius Ahenobarbus (consul 122 BC)|Gnaeus Domitius Ahenobarbus]] and [[Gaius Fannius]] |years=''with [[Titus Quinctius Flamininus (consul 123 BC)|Titus Quinctius Flamininus]]''<br/> 123 BC}} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Caecilius Metellus Balearicus, Quintus | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Caecilius Metellus Balearicus, Quintus}} [[Category:Roman Republican consuls]] [[Category:Roman censors]] [[Category:2nd-century BC Romans]] [[Category:History of the Balearic Islands]] [[Category:Caecilii|Metellus Balearicus, Quintus]] [[Category:170 BC births]] [[Category:Year of death unknown]] {{AncientRome-politician-stub}}
